sentences.en: "Why didn't you appoint Ron twelve months ago?"—"Good question."
sentences.cn: “你为什么12个月前不任命罗恩呢？”——“问得好。”

sentences.en: He could not force the bishop to appoint him.
sentences.cn: 他无法强迫主教委派他.

sentences.en: He promised to appoint an AIDS czar to deal with the disease.
sentences.cn: 他许诺任命一位艾滋病大使来应对这种疾病。

sentences.en: He proposes electing Franc to appoint a director.
sentences.cn: 他提议推选法朗西斯爵士任董事.

sentences.en: His appoint-ment is a complete surprise — he has never been mentioned as a front runner.
sentences.cn: 他的任命完全出人意料——他从来都不是呼声最高的候选人。

sentences.en: It made sense to appoint a banker to this job.
sentences.cn: 指派一位银行家做这份工作是明智之举。

sentences.en: Mel paused, to let his appoint sink home, before continuing.
sentences.cn: 梅尔稍停了一下, 好让大家都吃透他的论点后, 再继续说下去.

sentences.en: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
sentences.cn: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。

sentences.en: The company decided to appoint a Japanese manager as president of the company. The decision came as a bolt from the blue.
sentences.cn: 公司决定任命一位日籍经理担任总裁。这个决定太出乎意料了。

sentences.en: The king would appoint one of his creatures to the post.
sentences.cn: 国王要派他的一名奴仆去任这差事.

sentences.en: The Prime Minister has the power to dismiss and appoint senior ministers.
sentences.cn: 首相有权任免高级部长。

sentences.en: They appoint precinct election judges and other election - day officials.
sentences.cn: 他们委任选举区的评判员及在大选日工作的官员.

sentences.en: We must appoint a day to meet again.
sentences.cn: 我们要约定好下次会面的日期.

sentences.en: We must soon appoint a new teacher to the class.
sentences.cn: 我们必须尽快指派新老师到班里去.

sentences.en: We shall appoint eight o'clock as the time to begin.
You may appoint a proxy to vote for you.
sentences.cn: 你可以委托他人代你投票.

trans.tran_en: to choose someone for a position or a job
